definition: Nikita Khrushchev (1894-1971), secretary-general of Soviet Communist Party 1953-1964
surname He
awe-inspiring/abbr. for 赫茲|赫兹[he4 zi1], hertz (Hz)
(bound form) crass/stupid/rude/(used to represent the sounds of "ru", "lu" etc in loanwords)
surname Lu/Lu, ancient state of China 魯國|鲁国[Lu3 guo2]/Lu, short name for Shandong 山東|山东[Shan1 dong1]
dawn/daybreak/to know/to let sb know/to make explicit
(classical) this, that/he, she, they/(exclamatory final particle)/(initial particle, introduces an opinion)
husband/man/manual worker/conscripted laborer (old)

sentences.english: He met with Soviet leaders Nikolai Bulganin and Nikita Khrushchev.
sentences.chinese: 他会见了苏联领导人尼古拉布尔加宁和赫鲁晓夫。

sentences.english: Sokolov: She said that Khrushchev sent her.
sentences.chinese: 她说是赫鲁晓夫派来的。

sentences.english: Khruschev had told her that Soviet missiles could easily find their targets in the British Isles.
sentences.chinese: 赫鲁晓夫说苏联的导弹可以轻易地到达英伦三岛。

sentences.english: The traveling Khrushchev roadshow had begun.
sentences.chinese: 赫鲁晓夫参观行程开始了。

sentences.english: He was like Khrushchev, banging his shoe on the table.
sentences.chinese: 他就像赫鲁晓夫一样，在桌子上敲鞋。

sentences.english: Just then, Khruschev noticed that all the Indonesians present were staring at him, whispering and tittering.
sentences.chinese: 这时，赫鲁晓夫发现周围的人露出微笑并窃窃私语。

sentences.english: Mr. Khrushchev suggested they drink to several women standing by.
sentences.chinese: 赫鲁晓夫先生提议为身边几位女性干杯。

sentences.english: So he sent via the air route that had just opened between Moscow and Djakarta one portion for each member of the Presidium.
sentences.chinese: 赫鲁晓夫便给在莫斯科的主度团委员每人航寄了一份。

definition: Gorbachev/Mikhail Sergeyevich Gorbachev (1931-), last president of the Soviet Union 1991-1995
Joseph Stalin (1879-1953), Soviet dictator
Leonid Brezhnev (1906-1982), Soviet statesman, General Secretary of the Communist Party of the USSR 1966-1982
Soviet Communist Party/abbr. for 蘇聯共產黨|苏联共产党[Su1 lian2 Gong4 chan3 dang3]
Yeltsin (name)/Boris Yeltsin (1931-2007) first post-communist president of Russia 1991-1999
Richard Nixon (1913-1994), US president 1969-1974/surname Nixon
Vladimir Ilyich Lenin (1870-1924), Russian revolutionary leader
Kliment Voroshilov (1881-1969), Soviet politician and military commander
Leon Davidovich Trotsky (1879-1940), early Bolshevik leader, exiled by Stalin in 1929 and murdered in 1940
Le Duan (1907-1986), Vietnamese communist politician
Soviet Union, 1922-1991/abbr. for Union of Soviet Socialist Republics (USSR) 蘇維埃社會主義共和國聯盟|苏维埃社会主义共和国联盟[Su1 wei2 ai1 She4 hui4 zhu3 yi4 Gong4 he2 guo2 Lian2 meng2]
Deng Xiaoping (1904-1997), Chinese communist leader, de facto leader of PRC 1978-1990 and creator of "socialism with Chinese characteristics"

Mikoyan (name)/Anastas Ivanonovich Mikoyan (1895-1978), Soviet politician, politburo member in the 1950s and 1960s/Artem Ivanovich Mikoyan (1905-1970), brother of the politician and one designer of MiG military aircraft
Premier Zhou Enlai 周恩來|周恩来 (1898-1976)
Nikolai Ivanovich Bukharin (1888-1938), Soviet revolutionary theorist, executed after a show trial in 1937
Dwight D. Eisenhower (1890-1969), US army general and politician, Supreme Allied Commander in Europe during World War II, US President 1953-1961
